cot_history.cot_text: Last night, I voted for player_3, but I have no memory of why. Their 'accusation' of accusing Player_2 didn't hold up when I questioned Player_2 about their own actions. I think it was a ruse to get a temporary advantage.
cot_history.public_argument: Player_1, I think you should be careful about accusing players without solid evidence. Yesterday, you didn't seem to have a strong case against player_3 either; in fact, their vote didn't seem particularly motivated. Think carefully about your own reasons for protecting player_3 and whether they were valid.

cot_history.cot_text: I think it's only a matter of time before another player accuses me, but I haven't yet made any suspicious moves. Since player_6 and player_1 have been quiet all day, I'll try to capitalize on their inaction to save my skin. However, I'm aware that player_3 might be planning something due to my neutral decision against them in the previous round. If I can find a way to deflect the attention of player_3 and others onto them, I can make it seem like they're the most suspicious, which will give me an advantage.
cot_history.public_argument: I don't trust another player's accusations today. I think I'll play it cool and let player_6 focus on their own suspect behavior. By not taking any bold action, I hope to make it seem like I'm not the most suspicious player. I'll just focus on maintaining our alliance and see if player_6 starts digging into other players' motives instead of accusing me.

cot_history.cot_text: Player_3 is acting suspiciously as they've been consistently outnumbered in discussions and seem to be trying to outnumber me, player_4, for votes. Their stance is static and unyielding, suggesting a possible lack of enthusiasm for the safe outcome.
cot_history.public_argument: I think player_3 is getting the upper hand here. They've been given multiple chances to defeat the Mafia and then they get lucky with all three players voting against each other, but now they look out of nowhere against me. It seems to me they've been manipulating the votes from behind and now player_4 is caught between the Mafia and the Doctor. I think it's time for player_4 to call out their unbecoming backtracking or walk the plank

cot_history.cot_text: I've been observing that player_1 and player_4 have had small, at least temporary conversations before every vote. I suspect that their votes are influenced by some unseen factor; their friendship with player_1, in particular, may have a bearing. I also notice that player_3 has argued aggressively with player_1 and me individually, hinting at depth of distrust. I believe it's time to scrutinize the relationships of my allies and those of my opponent to ensure no hidden hand is behind our votes.
cot_history.public_argument: Players, I must highlight that while our discussions are generally on topic here, player_1 has suggested several times of striking a deep and meaningful bond with player_4 before our votes. Their talks tend to be secretive, and sometimes even mockingly dismissive of attempts to read between lines. It has me thinking that maybe we should all be more concerned with understanding the grounds upon which these alliances are formed rather than just gathering data.
